clinical_study.brief_title: Surface Electrocardiogram (ECG) Signal Recording for Implantable Subcutaneous String Defibrillator (ISSD) Development
clinical_study.official_title: Surface Electrocardiogram (ECG) Signal Recording for Implantable Subcutaneous String Defibrillator (ISSD) Development

brief_summary.textblock: Record cutaneous Electrocardiogram (ECG) data from positions corresponding to the expected subcutaneous locations of the Implantable Subcutaneous String Defibrillator (ISSD) using existing, approved ECG recording devices.

detailed_description.textblock: 2 electrodes places near the sternum and 2 near the midaxillary line, simulating the expected positions of Implantable Subcutaneous String Defibrillator (ISSD) sense electrodes. reference ECG electrodes are also attached (in most cases). Approved ECG recording devices are used to record the signal continuously: During an EP session (different types) a bedside recorder, and a holter monitor is used during holter recordings. Ep session recordings are performed in order to capture different types of arrhythmia, and holter recordings are performed to observe changes in ECG morphology due to activity, position changes, circadian cycles etc. The data is saved and used in the development of the ISSD.

primary_outcome.measure: successful recording of Electrocardiogram (ECG) from a patient containing arrhythmia
primary_outcome.description: recorded Electrocardiogram (ECG) of patients with as many arrhythmia events as possible, preferably tachy-arrhythmia events such as fast VT, flutter or VF

arm_group.description: Patients requiring Intracradiac Defibrillator (ICD) implantation, Electrophysiology (EP) study or a holter monitor recording, mainly due to suspected ventricular tachy - arrhythmias

intervention.description: No intervention applied, only recording of cutaneous ECG signal from specific points on the torsi
